description: From Latin frūstrātiō (“disappointment”), related to frūstrā (“in vain”). Synchronically analyzable as frustrate +‎ -ion.

entries.meaning: The feeling of annoyance at impassibility from resistance.

definitionGroups.group: The act of frustrating, or the state, or an instance of being frustrated.

entries.meaning: (law) The state of contract that allows a party to back away from its contractual obligations due to (unforeseen) radical changes to the nature of the thing a party has been obligated to.
Anger not directed at anything or anyone in particular.
